results.name: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = hypergeometric_2F1([n-k+1, -k], [1], -1) for n>=0 and k>=0.
comment: Previous name was: Triangle of coefficients of polynomials v(n,x) jointly generated with A160232; see the Formula section.
Alt. row sums: (1,-1,2,-3,...), signed Fibonacci numbers.

Subtriangle of the triangle T(n,k) given by (1, 0, -1/2, 1/2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...) DELTA (0, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...) where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 12 2012
Essentially triangle in A049600. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 23 2012
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..124 of triangle, flattened
formula: As DELTA-triangle with 0<=k<=n : T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) + 2*T(n-1,k-1) - T(n-2,k-1), T(0,0) = T(1,0) = T(2,0) = 1, T(1,1) = T(2,2) = 0, T(2,1) = 2 and T(n,k) = 0 if k<0 or if k>n. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 12 2012
The following remarks assume the row and column indexing start at 0.
Riordan array (1/(1 - x), x*(2 - x)/(1 - x)).
Read as a square array, this equals P * transpose(P^2), where P denotes Pascal's triangle A007318. (End)
program: tabl(nn) = for (n=0, nn, for (k=0, n, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print();); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 14 2015
